formattedAddress: 199 E 3rd St, New York, NY 10009, USA
adrFormatAddress: 199 E 3rd St, New York, NY 10009, USA

editorialSummary.text: No-frills stop for Asian eats for takeout & delivery, from Chinese food & Thai curries to teriyaki.

originalText.text:
I recently had the pleasure of ordering food from Asian Taste, and I must say that it was an absolutely delightful experience! From the moment I placed my order to the moment the delivery arrived at my doorstep, everything was flawless. I left my purse at work and he even waited for me to retrieve it!

First and foremost, the menu at Asian Taste is incredibly diverse and offers a wide range of Asian cuisine options, they have it all. The variety is impressive, and I appreciate having so many choices.

The delivery process was prompt and efficient. The food arrived at the promised time, and it was still piping hot and beautifully presented. It's evident that they take great care in packaging their dishes to ensure they arrive in perfect condition.

Now, let's talk about the food itself. It was absolutely delicious! Each dish was bursting with flavor and made with fresh, high-quality ingredients. The chicken was crispy and moist at the same time!

What sets Asian Taste apart, in my opinion, is not just the quality of their food but also their attention to detail and customer service. The delivery was friendly and flawless, which was a lovely touch and made me feel appreciated as a customer.

Overall, my experience with Asian Taste's food delivery was outstanding. I highly recommend them to anyone craving delicious Asian cuisine delivered right to their door. I will definitely be ordering from them again in the future. Kudos to the entire team at Asian Taste for a job well done!

originalText.text:
Dec '21
A very merry “Jewish” Christmas! May your egg rolls be crispy and your fortunes bright!

No, this isn’t a Hanukkah post. Hanukkah isn’t the Jewish Christmas but you can scroll down my account to find a Hanukkah post to learn more.

Instead, this is how many Jews “celebrate” Christmas - with Chinese food! I ordered General Tso’s chicken and white rice from Asian Taste.

Why this? Well it’s become kind of a Jewish tradition to eat Chinese food and go to the movies on Christmas Eve. Again, why? Well because Jews and Chinese were the most populous non-Christian immigrant groups in the Lower East Side, NYC. Neither celebrates Christmas but still wanted to enjoy the festive season and Chinese restaurants were one of the few still open Christmas Eve. Chinese made a great meal for semi-kosher Jews since the meals are meat based and don’t mix with milk. So in the late 1800s/early 1900s Jews found themselves eating out at Chinese restaurants. And it’s a sort of tradition since.

originalText.text: Wow the Grand Marnier Shrimp is OUTSTANDING. I have ordered it several times over the last several months. It pulls me out of a slump and the portions are terrific. The shrimp is cooked perfectly and bountiful. The candied walnuts are pleasing and different. The sauce, I would eat with a straw if I could! Gets even better in the fridge overnight. Yummy!

The shrimp is cooked perfectly and bountiful. The candied walnuts are pleasing and different. The sauce, I would eat with a straw if I could! Gets even better in the fridge overnight. Yummy!

originalText.text: Got a large tofu and broccoli with garlic sauce alongside some brown rice for $15! Good value considering I had enough leftover for basically a second meal. Very tasty also!

originalText.text: beef fried rice was gross. They made it in 2 minutes which was concerning and it all made sense when I started eating it and noticed the beef was grey and slimy. I’m never eating here again
